sentence.text: Drug Label for drug brand ELIQUIS, containing apixaban.

mmtx.phraseText: Drug Label for drug brand ELIQUIS,
Drug Label for drug brand ELIQUIS,

sentence.text: If anticoagulation with ELIQUIS must be discontinued for a reason other than pathological bleeding, coverage with another anticoagulant should be strongly considered see Dosage and Administration (2.4) and Warnings and Precautions (5.1).
If anticoagulation with ELIQUIS must be discontinued for a reason other than pathological bleeding, coverage with another anticoagulant should be strongly considered.
An increased rate of stroke was observed during the transition from ELIQUIS to warfarin in clinical trials in patients with nonvalvular atrial fibrillation.
If ELIQUIS must be discontinued for a reason other than pathological bleeding, consider coverage with another anticoagulant see Dosage and Administration (2.3).
Concomitant use of drugs affecting hemostasis increases the risk of bleeding.

ellipsisSentence.text: ELIQUIS increases the risk of bleeding and can cause serious, potentially fatal, bleeding see Dosage and Administration (2.2) and Adverse Reactions (6.1).

sentence.text: These include aspirin and other antiplatelet agents, other anticoagulants, heparin, thrombolytic agents, selective serotonin reuptake inhibitors, serotonin norepinephrine reuptake inhibitor, and nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAIDs) see Drug Interactions (7.3).
A specific antidote for ELIQUIS is not available.
Protamine sulfate and vitamin K would not be expected to affect the anticoagulant activity of apixaban.
There is no experience with antifibrinolytic agents (tranexamic acid, aminocaproic acid) in individuals receiving apixaban.
There is neither scientific rationale for reversal nor experience with systemic hemostatics (desmopressin and aprotinin) in individuals receiving apixaban.

Use of procoagulant reversal agents such as prothrombin complex concentrate, activated prothrombin complex concentrate, or recombinant factor VIIa may be considered but has not been evaluated in clinical studies.
Activated oral charcoal reduces absorption of apixaban, thereby lowering apixaban plasma concentration see Overdosage (10).
Inhibitors of CYP3A4 and P-gp increase exposure to apixaban and increase the risk of bleeding.
Inducers of CYP3A4 and P-gp decrease exposure to apixaban and increase the risk of stroke.
<item>Strong dual inhibitors of CYP3A4 and P-gp increase blood levels of apixaban: Reduce ELIQUIS dose to 2.5 mg or avoid concomitant use.

entity.text: Strong dual inhibitors of CYP3A4 and P-gp

mmtx.phraseText: P-gp increase blood levels of apixaban
P-gp increase blood levels of apixaban

sentence.text: <item>Simultaneous use of strong inducers of CYP3A4 and P-gp reduces blood levels of apixaban: Avoid concomitant use.

entity.text: strong inducers of CYP3A4 and P-gp

sentence.text: The dose of ELIQUIS should be decreased to 2.5 mg twice daily when it is coadministered with drugs that are strong dual inhibitors of CYP3A4 and P-gp, (e.g., ketoconazole, itraconazole, ritonavir, or clarithromycin) see Dosage and Administration (2.2) and Clinical Pharmacology (12.3).

entity.text: drugs that are strong dual inhibitors of CYP3A4 and P-gp

sentence.text: In patients already taking ELIQUIS at a dose of 2.5 mg twice daily, avoid coadministration with strong dual inhibitors of both CYP3A4 and P-gp see Dosage and Administration (2.2) and Clinical Pharmacology (12.3).

entity.text: strong dual inhibitors of both CYP3A4 and P-gp

mmtx.phraseText: ELIQUIS at a dose of 2.5 mg twice daily,

sentence.text: Avoid concomitant use of ELIQUIS with strong dual inducers of CYP3A4 and P-gp (e.g., rifampin, carbamazepine, phenytoin, St. John's wort) because such drugs will decrease exposure to apixaban see Clinical Pharmacology (12.3).

antecedentEntity.text: strong dual inducers of CYP3A4 and P-gp

entity.text: strong dual inducers of CYP3A4 and P-gp

sentence.text: 7.3 Anticoagulants and Antiplatelet Agents
Coadministration of antiplatelet agents, fibrinolytics, heparin, aspirin, and chronic NSAID use increases the risk of bleeding.

ellipsisSentence.text: Avoid concomitant use of ELIQUIS with strong dual inducers of CYP3A4 and P-gp (e.g., rifampin, carbamazepine, phenytoin, St. John's wort) because such drugs will decrease exposure to apixaban see Clinical Pharmacology (12.3).

sentence.text: APPRAISE-2, a placebo-controlled clinical trial of apixaban in high-risk post-acute coronary syndrome patients treated with aspirin or the combination of aspirin and clopidogrel, was terminated early due to a higher rate of bleeding with apixaban compared to placebo.

mmtx.phraseText: a placebo-controlled clinical trial of apixaban

sentence.text: In ARISTOTLE, concomitant use of aspirin increased the bleeding risk on ELIQUIS from 1.8% per year to 3.4% per year and the bleeding risk on warfarin from 2.7% per year to 4.6% per year.
